dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Health data for 1.6 million patients, that's the number that really jumps out from this DeepMind and Facebook story.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Google acquired DeepMind in 2014, four years after Suleyman cofounded the London-based lab with CEO Demis Hassabis, and the reported price tag400 million pounds or $650 million U.S. at the timesignified its big ambitions in artificial intelligence and DeepMinds technical expertise.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, through that kidney monitoring app, Streams. And it's wild because Mark Zuckerberg called that data-sharing arrangement a commendable practice back in 2017.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, through that kidney monitoring app, Streams. And it's wild because Mark Zuckerberg called that data-sharing arrangement a commendable practice back in twenty seventeen.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But then last year, Facebook just absorbed the whole health team into the main company, which basically dissolved DeepMind Health.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then last year, Facebook just absorbed the whole health team into the main company, which basically dissolved DeepMind Health.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Late last year, Google announced that Streams and the team working on it would be absorbed into Google proper, essentially dissolving the DeepMind Health group.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and you know, Zuckerberg's been running their applied AI division this whole time, trying to find real-world uses for all that research.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and you know, Zuckerberg's been running their applied A I division this whole time, trying to find real-world uses for all that research.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Suleyman has been running the groups applied AI division, which aims to find real-world uses its scientific research, and previously led the group's health efforts, including an extensively criticized 2016 partnership with the U.K.s National Health Service.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which is interesting because he and Sheryl Sandberg actually voted against setting up an internal ethics board for AI when Facebook first acquired DeepMind.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is interesting because he and Sheryl Sandberg actually voted against setting up an internal ethics board for A I when Facebook first acquired DeepMind.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As part of Google's acquisition of DeepMind, he and Hassabis even required that the company set up an internal ethics board to oversee AI work across all divisions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: That feels like a huge missed opportunity, especially since he wrote that op-ed saying AI safety was gonna be one of the, uh, least pressing areas to look into.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That feels like a huge missed opportunity, especially since he wrote that op-ed saying A I safety was gonna be one of the, uh, least pressing areas to look into.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We need to do the hard, practical and messy work of finding out what ethical AI really means, he wrote in a Wired op-ed in 2018, predicting that the study of the safety and societal impact of AI was going to be one of the most pressing areas of enquiry.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: People think tech leaders are all-in on ethical oversight, but actually they often resist it until they're forced. I mean, Bloomberg reported his leave was basically forced after the Cambridge Analytica stuff.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: People think tech leaders are all-in on ethical oversight, but actually they often resist it until they're forced. I mean, Bloomberg reported his leave was basically forced after the Cambridge Analytica stuff.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bloomberg originally reported news of Suleyman's departure, citing controversy over some of the projects he led.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And yet under his watch, DeepMind's pretax profits grew to what, like 570 million dollars? Even with revenues only at 125 million?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And yet under his watch, DeepMind's pretax profits grew to what, like five hundred seventy million dollars? Even with revenues only at one hundred twenty five million?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Google parent company Alphabet doesnt break out the balance sheets of its individual businesses in its earnings reports, but recent documents filed with the U.K.'s Companies House registry show that in 2018 DeepMinds pretax losses grew to $570 million with revenues of $125 million.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly—his team was responsible for generating revenue, according to reports. But at what cost, right? They were working with Amazon on voice recognition, cutting data center costs…
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly-his team was responsible for generating revenue, according to reports. But at what cost, right? They were working with Amazon on voice recognition, cutting data center costs...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Meanwhile, the applied AI team has worked on projects like a text-to-speech service for Google Cloud and cutting Googles data center cooling costs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's just such a contrast to Google, which set up an external ethics council and got praised for it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's just such a contrast to Google, which set up an external ethics council and got praised for it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier this year, Google tried to create an external artificial intelligence ethics council, but quickly dissolved the project in the wake of internal and external protest over its members.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Mhm. And now he's on leave, described as not expected to return. Ten years in, it's shows how these scandals catch up with you.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mhm. And now he's on leave, described as not expected to return. Ten years in, it's shows how these scandals catch up with you.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Ito Mustafa Suleyman Mustafas taking some time out right now after ten hectic years, the company said, describing the leave as a mutual decision and adding that the unit expects him back by the end of the year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB

dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. It's a forced break that might become permanent.
